text:
Arma is a city in Crawford County, Kansas, United States. The 2010, 1,481 people lived there.
History.
Arma was created in 1894. It was named after W.F. Armacost, an early landowner.
A post office was opened at Arma in 1891. It was used until it was closed in 1906.
Arma was a station on the Missouri Pacific Railroad.
Geography.
Arma is at (37.543679, −94.700472). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. Of that, is land and is water. It is located about 6 minutes' drive north of Frontenac, and about 8 minutes' drive east of Girard.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 1,481 people, 657 households, and 372 families living in Arma.
Education.
Arma is part of USD 246 Northeast.
Before school unification, the Arma High School mascot was Bulldogs.
